moves.1. e4: so here's another game of mine where i manage to win the game. White starts with e4.
moves.1... c5: i decided to go with the Sicilian
moves.2. e5: this move was surprising cause i didn't really know hot to react to this. it does stop my king side Knight development.
moves.2... f6 3. exf6 Nxf6: well it works like this also, but i weakened my king side a bit.
moves.4. d3 d5 5. Bf4 Nc6 6. Nc3 e5: here i have a nice central grip and also managed to kick the bishop w tempo.
moves.7. Bg5 Qb6 8. Bxf6 gxf6: now my king side is really weak, but in exchange i got his dsb, but I'm starting think about castling queen side.
moves.9. h3 Be6 10. a4 Qb4 11. a5: this move just loses a pawn. i didn't know what white was trying at this point.
moves.11... Nxa5 12. Ra4: now i see his point. attacking the queen and the knight. a nice move from white.
moves.12... Qxb2 13. Nce2: i was threatening qxc3+ so knight retreats.
moves.13... c4 14. d4 e4 15. Rxa5: this was a mistake because after 13.c4 my bishop gained scope and can now fork king and rook.
moves.17. f4 exf3 e.p. 18. Nxf3 Bxc3+: another pawn won. no problem, ill take it.
moves.19. Nxc3 Qxc3+ 20. Kf2 Rc8: decided to add support to c4, because its a passed pawn, and might be useful later on.
moves.21. Be2 O-O: Now i just want to connect my rooks and there's really no major threat if kings on g2.
moves.22. g4 Rc7 23. Rg1 Rcf7: doubling rooks to add pressure on the king after f pawn has been removed.
moves.24. h4 Rg7: had to take a little control of the g-file, because it could be dangerous´s with that rook on g1.
moves.25. Nh2 Qh3: I'm attacking the unprotected Knight so something has to be done.
moves.26. Rg2 Qxh4+: free pawn again, and with check now.
moves.27. Kg1 f5 28. Qb1 fxg4 29. Qd1 h5 30. R: rg3?? this is blunder, because i cant see any threats after takes.
moves.30... Qxg3+ 31. Kh1 Rf2 32. Qg1: by taking the queen i win the bishop.
moves.32... Qxg1+ 33. Kxg1 Rxe2 34. Nf1 c3: this pawn is now getting dangerous.
moves.35. Ng3: here black manages to win a pawn but is doesn't really matter.
moves.35... Rd2 36. Nxh5 Rf7 37. Ng3 c2: And here white resigned cause he cant stop the queening of the pawn. hope you enjoyed:)
